ingestedContentSummary.description: The Founder’s Fingerprint: How Startups Reflect Their Creators
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: Hashim’s other venture, HealTec, reveals a different facet of his personality. Here, his compassion and empathy take center stage, which stems from his core belief that empathy is at the heart of innovation. HealTec specializes in prosthetic and orthotic manufacturing, aiming to give patients a “second chance” through advanced digital manufacturing. The company goes beyond simply creating prosthetics and orthotics; it fosters a supportive environment where patients can become productive members of society. This focus on human potential aligns perfectly with Hashim’s desire to transform limitations into possibilities. From helping children to assisting those in need, HealTec reflects Hashim’s dedication to improving lives.

ingestedContentSummary.description: Parisian Grandeur: How the Past Can Inspire Our Future in the City of Lights
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: Paris, the City of Lights, recently dazzled me not only with its iconic sights, but with the breathtaking detail hidden within its grand museums. From the stained-glass brilliance of Saint-Chapelle to the inspiring historical preservation of antiquities at Basilique cathédrale Saint-Denis to the intricate sculptures of the Louvre, each location whispered stories of a bygone era where artistry thrived without the aid of modern technology. My journey began at Saint-Chapelle, a jewel box of a chapel. Sunlight streamed through the vast stained-glass windows, each panel a masterpiece depicting biblical scenes, but it wasn’t just the grand scale that captivated me. Upon closer inspection, I’ve noticed the meticulous details, the delicate shading in the Virgin Mary’s robes, the intricate patterns on the angels’ wings. These details, meant to be appreciated from afar, spoke volumes about the dedication of the artisans. They toiled for years, their only guide being their own meticulous vision and unwavering imagination. Next, I ventured to the imposing Saint-Denis Basilica, a final resting place for French royalty. Here, intricate stone carvings adorned the tombs, each depicting the deceased in exquisite detail — the folds of their clothing, the expressions on their faces. I couldn’t help but marvel at the sheer amount of time and skill required to create such work, especially considering the absence of power tools or 3D modeling software. While the De Cluny Museum boasts a treasure trove of artistic marvels, a hidden gem stole the show for me, the intricate wooden carvings! These unassuming sculptures, often relegated to the background, revealed a dedication to detail that goes beyond mere aesthetics. The focus wasn’t just on the central figures, but even the most seemingly insignificant characters, perhaps miniature saints, were imbued with individuality. Their facial expressions weren’t generic; they conveyed a spectrum of emotions, hinting at the inner lives of these miniscule figures. More interestingly, even background figures seemed to step out of the wood, not as idealized representations, but as real people of the era. This meticulous attention to detail speaks volumes about the artist’s respect for humanity. Every figure, no matter how small, was worthy of being portrayed as an individual. It wasn’t just about creating a grand narrative, but about weaving a tapestry of human experience within that narrative and of that era. This encounter with the wood carvings is a powerful reminder that greatness often lies in the seemingly insignificant details. It’s a call to appreciate the richness of human experience, even in the most unexpected corners. It compels us to see the world not as a collection of archetypes, but as a vibrant tapestry of unique individuals, each with their own story to tell. The Louvre, of course, was a sensory overload of artistic treasures. From the enigmatic smile of the Mona Lisa to the breathtaking Winged Victory of Samothrace, each piece was a testament to the boundless imagination and technical mastery of the artists. It’s mind-boggling to think that these awe-inspiring sculptures were brought to life with only rudimentary tools and the sheer force of human creativity.
ingestedContentSummary.title: Parisian Grandeur

Also, this fable is unique in that its short in length, uses simple language, and its fable format makes it accessible to a broad range of audience.
 
The book follows characters searching for cheese (representing their goals) in a maze (representing life). When the cheese disappears (change happens), some characters adapt while others resist, highlighting the importance of embracing change and staying flexible. ingestedContentSummary.description: The Paradox of Pain: How Pain Can Fuel Your Rise to the Top!
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: The road to exceptional performance is rarely paved with comfort. It’s a real paradox: the very experiences that inflict pain on us often hold the key to unlocking our greatest potential. This brief article will explore the intriguing connection between pain and high achievement based on my personal experience, and how to transform those painful moments into your greatest advantage! Our bodies are wired to react to pain as a survival mechanism. It serves as a primal alert system, a biological red flag if you will that something needs attention and immediate action. In the context of pushing boundaries, this pain, whether physical or emotional, serves a crucial purpose that triggers a response, where it signals the need for adaptation and improvement. Here’s where the pleasure connection emerges. Imagine an athlete pushing through a grueling workout regimen, where the burning muscles are a clear sign of pushing their limits. But within that discomfort lies a deeper truth: the body is adapting and growing stronger! When the athlete finally conquers that barrier, the sense of accomplishment is amplified tenfold. The pain becomes a badge of honor, a testament to the hard work invested instead of a bottomless pit of sorrow and remorse. Given the pain that we need to endure for us to reach to a better version of ourselves, how do we harness the power of pain to propel us forward? Here’s a simple 3-step roadmap: I’m known to reflect a lot of my actions and decisions, and there’s a fascinating connection that I’ve come to realize between pain and exceptional performance, and here are 3 reasons why I’ve come to find a connection: By acknowledging the pain, learning from it, and embracing the discomfort of growth, you can turn painful experiences into steppingstones for exceptional performance. There are several reasons why exceptional performers throughout history have often endured repeated failures and have gone through many painful experiences: It all boils down to your worldview and how you perceive the world around you! Exceptional performers become so not because of the pain, but in spite of it. They learn to use the pain as fuel, transforming setbacks into steppingstones and develop the mental fortitude to overcome challenges and keep pushing forward. Here’s another analogy for you to consider: Imagine a sculptor chipping away at a block of marble, where each chip is a small failure, a moment of discomfort, but with each chip, the vision becomes clearer, the masterpiece starts to emerge from the lifeless boring chunk of marble. The sculptor doesn’t become exceptional because of the chipping, but despite the effort and the dust it creates. So, while pain is often a companion on the road towards exceptional performance, it’s the exceptional individual’s ability to learn from it and keep moving forward that truly sets them apart from the rest of the crowd. We become prisoners of our own thoughts if we allow them to take control over our lives, so be careful how you connect the dots of the painful experiences that you had to endure. Exceptional performance isn’t about avoiding pain; it’s about embracing it as a teacher. By acknowledging the pain, dissecting its source, and using it to fuel your growth, you can transform those difficult moments into the launchpad for your greatest achievements. Remember, the discomfort you experience today could be the catalyst that propels you past the competition tomorrow. So, don’t shy away from the pain, instead, learn from it, leverage it, and rise above it. You’ll always have some sort of conflict going on in your life, so you must learn to enjoy life while still solving them. Strangely, there’s beauty in everything that we experience, so you need to adjust your perception about the world around you. When it’s all said and done, you have one of two choices, you could either cry in the storm or dance in the rain! The choice is yours, so choose wisely. I chose to walk down the path less traveled, and I have to say; although the path towards success for me was very difficult, wet, and muddy, that it nearly consumed me physically, financially, psychologically, and emotionally, it came with a breathtaking view!

ingestedContentSummary.description: The Lonely Lumberjack: When Your Passion Becomes Your Prison
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: Scrolling through my usual art feed on my phone, I stumbled upon a photo render by Tom Booth that stopped me dead in my tracks. It depicted a burly lumberjack, muscles straining, meticulously carving a delicate female hand from a block of wood. But the scene wasn’t idyllic. The background was a cold icy winter with daylight fading into the horizon. By gazing into the image, we can see the lumberjack not amidst the grandeur of a forest, but hunched over a tree trunk, muscles straining as he carves wood. Yet, the true weight he carries isn’t physical. The lumberjack sculpts breathtaking figures; women, each with an ethereal beauty that seems to mock the workshop’s cluttered reality. A half-eaten meal sits cold, a stark contrast to the life he breathes into the wood. You can almost sense the presence of a faded photograph somewhere under a pile of shavings, a glimpse of a smiling family; a wife, children, their faces etched with a happiness he seems to have missed. The artist’s message is a gut punch. This lumberjack, a man of raw strength and evident talent, is trapped in a self-made prison. He dedicates himself to his craft, a workaholic driven by an insatiable hunger to perfect his art. The artist’s message was clear just as it was haunting to me. This lumberjack, a sculptor by passion, was a man trapped in a paradox. He poured his heart into his art, yet the very act of creation seemed to isolate him from the life he was presumably building; a hot meal gone cold, a family yearning for attention. The lumberjack’s masterpieces were born from his life of isolation. The unfinished meal speaks of long hours spent hunched over wood, the photograph of his family; a silent testament to neglected relationships. The lumberjack’s eyes hold a deep sadness, a man yearning for connection even as his calloused hands create beauty from a distance. His story resonated with me so profoundly, especially during the early years of my startup company DarTec Engineering, where I nearly drove myself over the edge towards the brink of total disaster. The image sparked a reflection on the nature of workaholism. Why do some choose to spend a disproportionate amount of time focused on work, often at the expense of personal connections? These imageries of different lonely lumberjacks touch on a tender cord because it delves into the complexities of passion and purpose; two forces that drive my every action in life. So, I stopped and asked myself, is relentless pursuit of a calling worth the sacrifice of loved ones? The answer, of course, is far from simple. There can’t be a single answer. Perhaps it’s the pursuit of an elusive goal, the intoxicating thrill of achievement. Maybe it’s a fear of failure, a relentless drive to prove their worth. Or it could be a coping mechanism, a way to escape personal struggles by burying themselves in work. Perhaps the lumberjack finds solace in his art, a form of escape from a life he feels he can’t control. Maybe the faces he sculpts are a manifestation of the love and connection he craves but struggles to express. Or it could be a desperate attempt to immortalize the happiness he feels he’s losing. The lumberjack artist work illustrations embody this internal conflict perfectly. He creates breathtaking pieces, channeling his raw strength into elegant forms, but the cost is a fractured personal life. The rendered images leave you wondering; is the finished model worth the lonely dinner and the yearning of his family? The images force us to confront the harsh realities of a workaholic lifestyle. While ambition is admirable, a life devoid of human connection is a hollow victory. The lumberjack’s masterpieces are a testament to his talent, but the true cost lies in the neglected relationships around him. The artist’s struggle is a cautionary tale for all of us. It’s a reminder that true fulfillment lies in finding balance. We must nurture our passions, but never at the expense of the love that grounds us. The greatest works of art, after all, are not just the ones we create, but the lives we build and the memories we share. The lumberjack’s story may be a work of fiction, but it leaves a lasting impression. It’s a call to action, a plea to find harmony between our passions and our obligations. Let us strive for excellence, but never forget the beauty that lies outside the workshop; the warmth of a loved one’s embrace, the laughter that fills a home. Only then can we truly create a masterpiece of a life. The lumberjack illustrations lingered in my mind long after I’ve scrolled past them on my phone. It mirrored my own internal battle, a constant tug-of-war between following my calling and nurturing the ones I love. Like the sculptor, my work is my passion. Words flow through me, demanding to be shaped in the form of products, services, stories, articles, and scripts. It’s a relentless drive, a fire that burns brightest within me during the quiet hours of the night when I’m all alone, but the cost is steep! Every stolen hour to write becomes a missed dinner with my wife, a canceled night-out with friends, or forgetting to call people in my circles who’re going through rough patches in their lives to remind them that I’m here for them. The memories I yearn to build seem to slip through my fingers like sawdust. The guilt gnaws at me. Am I failing them, sacrificing their happiness for this self-imposed mission burden that I’ve demanded of myself? My mind spins with justifications. I’m creating something meaningful, leaving a legacy of amazing work that benefits many people around me and an inventory of words in the form of articles and book summaries on Medium for people to enjoy, so isn’t that what truly matters? But a hollow echo answered back; what use is a legacy built on a foundation of fractured relationships? My family needs me present, not just providing for them. My wife craves my undivided attention, not the hurried “I love you” mumbled between keystrokes and rushed phone calls between meetings while on business travels. My friends miss the camaraderie, the shared laughter that fades with every canceled meet-up. Perhaps the answer doesn’t lie in abandoning my passion altogether, but in finding a new rhythm. Maybe it’s carving out dedicated writing hours outside of work, precious but finite, while fiercely guarding the rest for them. It could mean learning to say no to extra projects, prioritizing moments of connection over fleeting deadlines. The lumberjack artist serves as a reminder, a call to action. I won’t let my passion become a prison, isolating me from the very people who inspire and ground me. I’ll strive to find a balance, to be the artist who creates beautiful stories, but also the husband and friend who builds memories that will resonate long after the last word is written. The masterpiece, after all, isn’t just on the page; it’s the life we weave together.
ingestedContentSummary.title: The Lonely Lumberjack

message.text:
The Lonely Lumberjack: When Your Passion Becomes Your Prison

Scrolling through my usual art feed on my phone, I stumbled upon a photo render by Tom Booth that stopped me dead in my tracks. It depicted a burly lumberjack, muscles straining, meticulously carving a delicate female hand from a block of wood, but the lumberjack seemed to be overwhelmed with sadness & regret.  

This lumberjack, a man of raw strength & evident talent, seems to be trapped in a self-made prison. He dedicated himself to his craft, a workaholic driven by an insatiable hunger to perfect his art, but it comes at a cost. The artist's message was clear just as it was haunting to me. This lumberjack was a man trapped in a paradox of his own making!

Art, in its purest form, is an expression of the human experience. In this article, I’ll attempt to explain how the photo rendered illustration of a depressed lumberjack can transcend its digital form, prompting a discussion on the delicate balance between ambition & connection. While the lumberjack artist may be a fictional construct, its story is a cautionary tale for all of us. After all, the greatest masterpieces are often the connections we build, not just the ones we create:

https://lnkd.in/dNmWDvwk

ingestedContentSummary.fullText: Happiness is a complex concept, and that’s precisely why it can be so elusive. Happiness is a positive emotional state characterized by feelings of joy, contentment, and satisfaction. It can be brief or long-lasting, and it can be triggered by various experiences or events. Psychologists often differentiate between happiness as an emotion (feeling good) and life satisfaction (feeling good about your life as a whole), and I’m not a psychologist, so I’ll be addressing how I view happiness from a wholistic point of view in terms of life satisfaction. People have unique values, personalities, and life experiences that shape what brings them joy. What makes one person happy might not resonate with another, so here are some reasons why happiness varies from one person to another: There are a few reasons why many people look for happiness externally: Here’s why finding happiness within is ultimately more fulfilling: Remember, finding happiness within doesn’t mean isolating yourself. Strong relationships are important, but they should complement your inner well-being, not be the sole source of it. The journey to inner happiness involves self-discovery, cultivating gratitude, and building a life that reflects your values. It’s an ongoing process, but it empowers you to create lasting joy from within. Growth often comes from overcoming challenges. While difficult experiences themselves might not be pleasurable, successfully navigating them can lead to a deeper sense of accomplishment, resilience, GRIT, and appreciation for the good times. The journey of self-discovery is crucial for understanding what truly brings you happiness. By exploring your values, passions, and goals, you gain a clearer picture of what a fulfilling life looks like for you. This self-awareness empowers you to make choices and pursue experiences that align with your unique definition of happiness. Remember, happiness is not a destination, but rather a journey. It’s about appreciating the good times, learning from the bad ones, and cultivating a life that brings you a sense of meaning and fulfillment. Your “Why” statement serves as a roadmap to your own happiness by providing clarity and direction. Here’s how developing your “Why” statement can help you find true happiness: Imagine you truly understand your “Why”, your core purpose and motivations. Now, imagine all your actions and decisions stem from that understanding, what would your next move look like? You’re no longer chasing short-lived pleasures or societal expectations. Instead, you’re actively building a life that brings you meaning and fulfillment. This alignment between your “Why” and your actions is the recipe for true finding your true happiness. Remember, your “Why” statement is a living document, and it can evolve as you grow and experience life. The important thing is to take the time to explore what truly drives you and use that knowledge to create a life that sparks genuine happiness and is remembered long after you’re gone… Create a Supportive Environment Remember, finding your why is a personal journey and there’s no right or wrong answer, and it’ll evolve over time. The key is to be introspective and identify what brings meaning and purpose to your life. By sharing your why and creating a supportive space, you can inspire others to embark on their own journey of self-discovery.

ingestedContentSummary.description: The Art of Self-Discipline: The Glue that Ties Hard Work with Intelligence
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: Most of the people I’ve met in my life are super intelligent and hard workers, but for some odd reason, they lack the discipline to show for it. It’s as if they’ve reached a glass ceiling, where anymore effort that they put forth wouldn’t budge. So, why is that? Why isn’t it enough to have knowledge, skills, and hard work ethic to realize our goals? Someone who’s self-disciplined has the ability to control themselves against urges and the pleasures of life and work hard in a particular way without needing anyone else to tell them what to do or even encourage them. I’ve never been the brightest or the smartest at school or in life for that matter, but you can bet your top dollar that I’m one of the most disciplined people you’ll ever meet.
ingestedContentSummary.title: The Art of Self-Discipline

ingestedContentSummary.title: From Self-Doubt to Self-Confidence

message.text:
Reimagining Self-Doubt: Understanding where it Comes From and How to Circumvent it
 
As we grow older and somewhere along our development, a pattern of thinking starts to emerge, which leads us to experience self-doubt. If we're not careful and allow these patterns to repeat themselves many times in our consciousness, they’ll tend to morph into entrenched limiting beliefs that kill our confidence and prevent us from expressing our innate potential.
 
In this article, I’ll be sharing with you my experience with self-doubt, the Mind Pits that we fall into, and how to circumvent them. I’ve identified 4 distinct self-doubt Mind Pits that most of us are unaware of:
1. Failure to Execute
2. ⁠Playing it Safe
3. ⁠Destination Obsession
4. ⁠Comparing Yourself to Others
 
These Mind Pits could end-up taking control over our lives if we allow them to go unchecked and without question. This article boils down to how we can move from Self-Doubt to Self-Confidence:

https://lnkd.in/d8XeVTHM

DarTec Engineering HealTec Rehab #article #blog

ingestedContentSummary.description: Dancing with Fire: Embracing Setbacks & Unleashing the Beast within you when Depression, Fear, and Anxiety Cloud your Judgment
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: There are unwelcome guests, who cast long shadows over our lives, and they’re none other than Depression, Fear, and Anxiety! These companions can dim the light within our souls, leaving us feeling lost, paralyzed, shackled, and defeated. So, what if, within those setbacks, lies the very spark that can ignite the fire within us? A fire that’s fueled by resilience, purpose, and an unwavering spirit to become the best we can be. Learning to live with these challenges isn’t about banishing them entirely, but about learning to dance in the fire they create. You need to acknowledge the darkness that lies within you because ignoring the presence of these powerful emotions fuels the flames of self-blame and isolation. Instead, practice compassionate self-awareness by recognizing the feelings without judgment, allowing yourself to experience them authentically. Remember that you’re not defined by your struggles and defeats and it’s not the end for you, but a steppingstone. Each setback and stumble, holds valuable lessons that shape who you are today. Reflect on what happened, but don’t dwell on it. Instead, ask yourself: What can I learn from this experience? How can I be better prepared next time?

ingestedContentSummary.description: The Art of the Start: The Time-Tested, Battle-Hardened Guide for Anyone Starting Anything
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: Pursuing meaningful goals starts with a problem that’s begging to be solved, followed by the actions required to embark on a transformative journey that starts from within yourself. This burning desire would be channeled through your actions out into the world in the form of impactful outcome. When you establish purpose-driven goals, reflect on your values and passions and determine long-term aspirations that genuinely resonate with your innermost drive. As you align your goals with your values, passion, and most importantly, higher purpose, you’ll find a renewed sense of fulfillment and motivation. Pursuing these meaningful objectives sets the stage for the journey of a lifetime with true impact and ultimate success! To start some larger-than-life objective like starting your own business, you need to ask yourself the obvious question: Where should I start? Ironically, we get so caught-up planning for our business that we end-up missing the big picture; Would it work? Getting bogged with analysis paralysis leads us to skipping over the very first step of starting our business: Why should anyone care? In this book summary, you’ll get expose to13 business artforms that will give you enough information to take that first step towards building your startup company. You’ll learn that starting a purpose-driven company is part technical and part art. You’ll also learn how to pitch your business idea for funding, and learn how to survive even if you don’t get it. You’ll understand how companies can position themselves successfully and create powerful brands. You’ll also discover why you shouldn’t be afraid of hiring people who’re smarter than you, and what makes some products so popular that they become contagious and spread like wildfire. One of the greatest lessons I’ve learned in life is that: I don’t always get to where I wanted to be, but I always end-up somewhere better! Here are the 13 artforms that you need to consider when embarking on developing your own business: In the following sections, I’ll brush over each of the 13 artforms of starting your own business and I’ll also share personal stories from my own journey of starting 2 technology-based companies in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia that would demonstrate how each point is applied in real life.
ingestedContentSummary.title: The Art of the Start 2.0

message.text:
The Art of the Start: The Time-Tested, Battle-Hardened Guide for Anyone Starting Anything
By Guy Kawasaki
 
The hardest part of any project is starting it, and this is especially true when it comes to businesses. In this book summary, you’ll get expose to 13 business artforms that will give you enough information to take that first step towards building your startup company. You’ll learn that starting a purpose-driven company is part technical and part art. You'll also learn how to pitch your business idea for funding, and learn how to survive even if you don't get it. You'll understand how companies can position themselves successfully & create powerful brands. You’ll also discover why you shouldn't be afraid of hiring people who’re smarter than you, and what makes some products so popular that they become contagious and spread like wildfire. One of the greatest lessons I’ve learned in life is that: I don’t always get to where I wanted to be, but I always end-up somewhere better!
 
In this summary, I’ll share personal stories from my own journey of starting 2 technology-based companies (DarTec & HealTec) that would demonstrate how each point is applied in real life:

https://lnkd.in/dkkSWhts
